article.headline: Detroit 92, Buffalo 84, OT
article.story: AMHERST, N.Y. (AP) -- -Ryvon Covile scored 23 points and grabbed 12 rebounds as Detroit rallied for a 92-84 overtime win over Buffalo on Saturday night. Brandon Cotton scored 22 points, while Jon Goode scored 18, including eight while also going 5-for-5 from the foul line in overtime, as Detroit (10-17) snapped a four-game losing skid. Eric Moore led Buffalo (11-15) with 19 points, connecting on 5-of-10 3-pointers. Byron Mulkey scored 13 points for the Bulls while Andrew Atman had 10 points. Buffalo got 29 points off its bench in taking 40-38 lead at halftime. The Bulls opened up a six-point advantage in the second half, but an 8-2 Titans run gave Detroit the lead, 75-74, with 2:45 left. After Covile's dunk put Detroit up 77-74 with 1:21 left, Moore converted a fade-away 3-pointer with 59 seconds remaining to tie the game at 77. Cotton had a chance to win it in regulation, but his layup off a spinning drive through the lane bounced off the hoop at the buzzer. Detroit outscored Buffalo 15-7 in overtime, going 3-for-3 from the floor and 8-for-9 from the foul line, while the Bulls hit just 2-for-9 from the floor.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
